title: American_Top_40_1988_August_6th_Final_Broadcast
description:
American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988.

This was Casey Kasem's last broadcast of American Top 40 that.

In this broadcast:

Casey tells how Elvis' biggest hit was inspired by a shaken soda pop bottle.

One listener writes in to ask, "In five decades of the Billboard charts, who has been the top male solo singer of each decade?"

Philadelphia native Will Smith (Men in Black, Independence Day) is in the countdown as "The Fresh Prince" with "DJ Jazzy Jeff" and their hit, "Parents Just Dont Understand."

There is a new band named in this countdown "Guns 'N' Roses."

Casey tells the story of the biggest hit of the rock era. The man who had the hit said it wasn't because he sang it well, or because it was a great song, but because the record came with instructions.

Casey answers the question, "In the rock era, what act has had the most hits in the top 40 at the same time?"

Casey explains the origins of the expressions, "To make a monkey out of someone," "Monkey-suit," and "Monkey-wrench."
